page.title: 10CROFTING
page.content: THERE ARE MANY CROFTS IN SHETLAND.ONLY A CROFTER KNOWS HOW MANY HOURS ARE PUT INTO IT. BEFORE NOW,EVERY FAMILY OWNED A CROFT BECAUSE IT WAS THE ONLY WAY THEY COULD GET MEAT,VEGETABLES ETC. THEY KEPT LOTS OF ANIMALS AND GREW LOTS OF VEGETABLES. TODAY WE HAVE MACHINERY TO WORK WITH,LIKE TRACTORS AND PLOUGHS. BUT, IN THE OLDEN DAYS THEY ONLY HAD HORSES TO PLOUGH. WE ALSO HAVE THINGS LIKE COMBINE HARVESTERS AND CORNCUTTERS BUT THEY ONLY USED SYTHES TO CUT THE GRASS ETC. THE FAMILIES ALSO HAD TO MAKE THEIR OWN FLOUR ,SO FIRST THEY CUT THE BY HAND,PUT IT INTO A HAND THRESHER, GROUND IT ON BIG STONES IN A MILL AND THEN IT WAS READY TO MAKE BREAD WITH. LIVING ON A CROFT THEN WAS HARDER WORK THAN TO LIVE ON ONE NOW.
